meanings.definition: Repeating or occurring in a repeated manner.
meanings.sent1: The song had a repetitive melody that played over and over.
meanings.sent2: The repetitive sound of the clock ticking became soothing background noise.
meanings.sent3: The repetitive knocking on the door made the cat curious.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like a repetitive loop, stuck on the same thought.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive tapping of raindrops on the window created a calming rhythm.

meanings.sent1: His speech was so repetitive that it became predictable.
meanings.sent2: The repetitive nature of the task made it feel monotonous.
meanings.sent3: The repetitive jokes at the party kept everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: The repetitive pattern of the wallpaper gave the room a sense of continuity.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive chirping of the birds outside signaled the start of a new day.

meanings.sent1: The dance routine was repetitive, with the same steps repeated throughout.
meanings.sent2: The teacher used a repetitive teaching method to help students remember key concepts.
meanings.sent3: The repetitive clicking of the keyboard filled the room with a rhythmic sound.
meanings.sent4: His dreams were filled with repetitive images that left him feeling unsettled.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive motion of the waves crashing against the shore was mesmerizing.
